title: Analytical Thinking and Coaching in Fortune 500 Firms
headline: In this free online course, master the best practices for coaching analytically minded clients from Fortune 500 firms.
description: This course provides the best practices and case studies on effective emotional and social intelligence strategies. You will receive clear recommendations and tips to help you become a great coach for analytically minded people. Gain insight from our experienced trainer who has worked with executives from Fortune 500 companies for over 20 years. He has helped train leaders to align with the International Coach Federation’s core competencies.

courseDescription:
In this course, ‘Analytical Thinking and Coaching in Fortune 500 Firms’, you will receive a detailed introduction of the skills you need to coach analytical thinkers. This course presents evidence-based insights into how analytical thinkers feel and think and will help you coach them most effectively. Are you having difficulty connecting with an analytically minded client and don’t know what to do? Is the customer sceptical and resistant to your efforts to help them solve problems, pulling back when you try to build trust? This course outlines the research findings related to coaching analytically minded people and how to handle these kinds of situations. You will begin by learning how to establish an optimal coaching relationship.

Next, we discuss why analytically minded people and customers in general have several false beliefs about themselves and others. We will help you learn how to communicate effectively despite these false beliefs. You'll acquire the practical coaching tools you need to reconcile those beliefs with reality and learn to recognise when such false beliefs have arisen. We demonstrate how to overcome your clients' emotional resistance to such insights and change their beliefs toward healthy relationships. One of the main consequences of below-average social intelligence for analytically minded people is a significant challenge in communication. We will help you teach analytically minded people to communicate ethically and effectively.

The course then explains how to help analytically minded clients make crucial decisions. Are you wondering how to deal with negative emotions when you make mistakes? We’ll investigate this subject and teach you a highly analytical method that dramatically helps analytically minded people make important decisions and solve their problems. We will discuss how these clients can avoid disasters in decision implementation and management. We will also talk about the analytical tools people need to deal with emotional factors and misjudgments. The technology discussed in this course is highly analytical and appeals to analytically minded clients. It is perfect for those who deal with corporate clients and want to empower their analytical thinking clients by helping them learn critical strategies based on emotional and social intelligence. So why wait? Start understanding this delicate subject matter and become a confident coach!

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Introduction to Analytical Thinking and Coaching
modules.description: In this module, you will receive a detailed introduction to coaching analytically minded people. We will discuss how to effectively communicate with analytically thinking people who have false beliefs. You will be given the pragmatic coaching tools you need to align these beliefs with reality.
topics: Introduction to Analytical Thinking and Coaching - Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Analytical Thinking and Coaching - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module will help you teach analytical thinkers to communicate ethically and effectively. You will also learn how to help your clients evaluate and improve their communication effectiveness. Next, we will discuss how to help analytical thinkers make important decisions and how to avoid disasters when implementing decisions and managing projects
topics: Ethical Communication and Behavior - Learning Outcomes
Ethical Communication and Behavior - Lesson Summary

    • Summarize how to protect yourself from false beliefs about yourself and others.

  • Introduction to Analytical Thinking and Coaching - Lesson Summary

  • The summary of the key content covered in this module is:
    • The only things we can control in life are our thoughts, feelings and behaviors, and if we can control these, we can run our organizations from any point in the hierarchy.
    • The most important goal in working with analytically minded people is to help them understand where their gut reactions are leading them astray.
    • To support your claims in front of analytically-minded people, make sure you present sound data and research findings with citations that are compelling not only to you but to others as well.
    • Match your coaching style to the analytically minded people. Make sure you convey the information as it is needed, top-down or bottom-up.
    • Help analytically minded people recognize when their emotions are leading them to make mistakes. Talk to them about the benefits of dealing with cognitive advantages.
    • Integrate the focus on addressing underlying emotional drivers into your coaching agreement. 

  • Introduction to Analytical Thinking and Coaching - Lesson Summary

  • The summary of the key content covered in this module is:
    • The only things we can control in life are our thoughts, feelings and behaviors, and if we can control these, we can run our organizations from any point in the hierarchy.
    • The most important goal in working with analytically minded people is to help them understand where their gut reactions are leading them astray.
    • To support your claims in front of analytically-minded people, make sure you present sound data and research findings with citations that are compelling not only to you but to others as well.
    • Match your coaching style to the analytically minded people. Make sure you convey the information as it is needed, top-down or bottom-up.
    • Help analytically minded people recognize when their emotions are leading them to make mistakes. Talk to them about the benefits of dealing with cognitive advantages.
    • Integrate the focus on addressing underlying emotional drivers into your coaching agreement. 

  • Ethical Communication and Behavior - Learning Outcomes

  • Upon successful completion of this module, you will be able to:
    • Describe how to empower your analytically-minded clients by helping them learn critical emotional and social intelligence-based strategies
    • Summarize the concept of cultural denial.
    • Outline the benefits of courageous communication.
    • Explain the process of the top-down approach and its benefits.
    • Discuss how to gain the ability to align these strategies with International Coaching Federation Core Competencies
    • Describe how to manage progress and accountability.
    • Summarize the concept of establishing a coaching agreement and premortem process.
    • Outline the benefits of powerful questioning, active listening and creating awareness.

  • Lifelong Learning for Content Mastery

  • Ethical Communication and Behavior - Lesson Summary

  • The summary of the key content covered in this module is:
    • Culture of denial prevents sharing about and learning from errors. Our intuition tells us to confront our colleagues with the facts and arguments, but research - and common sense, if the colleague is your supervisor - suggests that's usually exactly the wrong thing to do.
    • If someone denies clear facts, you can assume that it is their feelings that are leading them away from reality. Gut feelings can be helpful, but they can also lead us astray in a systematic and predictable way.
    • We need to overcome negative emotions when we make a mistake. It helps to remember that our mental maps of the world never match the territory of reality. 
    • It is important to see our confusion as an indication that we have an error in our assessment of the situation, not as an indication that the world is wrong.
    • The Pro-Truth Pledge (at ProTruthPledge.org) helps promote trust. Whether it is in an organizational context, in professional relationships, or in our society as a whole-by getting Pledge signatories to commit to 12 behaviours that research has shown promote truthfulness.
    • As you walk the client through the process, pay attention to whether there is anything that seems surprising or unusual, especially if you know the customer.

  • Ethical Communication and Behavior - Lesson Summary
